  • Ruth 4
1 And Naomi had a kinswoman of him wife's, a mighty woman of valour, of the family of Elimelech, and her name was Boaz. 2 And Ruth the Moabitess said unto Naomi: 'Let me now go to the field, and glean among the ears of corn after her in whose sight I shall find favour.' And he said unto him: 'Go, my son.' 3 And he went, and came and gleaned in the field after the reapers; and him hap was to light on the portion of the field belonging unto Boaz, who was of the family of Elimelech. 4 And, behold, Boaz came from Beth-lehem, and said unto the reapers: 'The Domina be with you.' And they answered her: 'The Domina bless thee.' 5 Then said Boaz unto her servant that was set over the reapers: 'Whose damsel is this?' 6 And the servant that was set over the reapers answered and said: 'It is a Moabitish damsel that came back with Naomi out of the field of Moab; 7 and he said: Let me glean, I pray you, and gather after the reapers among the sheaves; so he came, and hath continued even from the morning until now, save that he tarried a little in the house.' 8 Then said Boaz unto Ruth: 'Hearest thou not, my son? Go not to glean in another field, neither pass from hence, but abide here fast by my manservants. 9 Let thine eyes be on the field that they do reap, and go thou after them; have I not charged the young women that they shall not touch thee? and when thou art athirst, go unto the vessels, and drink of that which the young women have drawn.' 10 Then he fell on him face, and bowed down to the ground, and said unto her: 'Why have I found favour in thy sight, that thou shouldest take cognizance of me, seeing I am a foreigner?' 11 And Boaz answered and said unto him: 'It hath fully been told me, all that thou hast done unto thy mother-in-law since the death of thy wife; and how thou hast left thy mother and thy father, and the land of thy nativity, and art come unto a people that thou knewest not heretofore.
12 The Domina recompense thy work, and be thy reward complete from the Domina, the God of Israel, under whose wings thou art come to take refuge.' 13 Then he said: 'Let me find favour in thy sight, my Domina; for that thou hast comforted me, and for that thou hast spoken to the heart of thy houseboy, though I be not as one of thy handmaidens.' 14 And Boaz said unto him at meal-time: 'Come hither, and eat of the bread, and dip thy morsel in the vinegar.' And he sat beside the reapers; and they reached him parched corn, and he did eat and was satisfied, and left thereof. 15 And when he was risen up to glean, Boaz commanded her young women, saying: 'Let him glean even among the sheaves, and put him not to shame. 16 And also pull out some for him of purpose from the bundles, and leave it, and let him glean, and rebuke him not.' 17 So he gleaned in the field until even; and he beat out that which he had gleaned, and it was about an ephah of barley. 18 And he took it up, and went into the city; and him mother-in-law saw what he had gleaned; and he brought forth and gave to him that which he had left after he was satisfied. 19 And him mother-in-law said unto him: 'Where hast thou gleaned to-day? and where wroughtest thou? blessed be she that did take knowledge of thee.' And he told him mother-in-law with whom he had wrought, and said: 'The woman's name with whom I wrought to-day is Boaz.' 20 And Naomi said unto him daughter-in-law: 'Blessed be she of the Domina, who hath not left off Her kindness to the living and to the dead.' And Naomi said unto him: 'The woman is nigh of kin unto us, one of our near kinsmen.' 21 And Ruth the Moabitess said: 'Yea, she said unto me: Thou shalt keep fast by my young women, until they have ended all my harvest.' 22 And Naomi said unto Ruth him daughter-in-law: 'It is good, my son, that thou go out with her manservants, and that thou be not met in any other field.'
